title: Hello, RamOn Systems
excerpt: Welcome to my IT notes—quick fixes, hard‑won lessons, and scripts.
content:
Welcome to RamOn Systems — my running log of fixes, scripts, and troubleshooting notes.

This site is where I document solutions so I never need to solve the same problem twice.

More posts coming soon!

title: Windows: Printer Stuck in Queue? Try This First
excerpt: When jobs won’t clear, here’s the fastest path to a working printer.
content:
If your printer is stuck in queue, here is the fastest fix:

  1. Open services.msc.
  2. Stop the Print Spooler service.
  3. Go to C:\Windows\System32\spool\PRINTERS
  4. Delete all files in that folder.
  5. Start the Print Spooler service again.

Most queue issues are resolved instantly after clearing the spool files.

title: About RamOn Systems
